alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 8:59AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding of low lying areas * WHERE...Innoko River at Shageluk * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the Innoko River at Shageluk. Residents report water over some roads near the river. The high water will likely cause significant erosion to some riverbanks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 837 AM AKDT, An ice jam that was on the Yukon River upriver from Grayling has caused a significant amount of water to flow overland and into the Innoko River. This surge of water is moving down the Innoko River and resulting in minor flooding. This surge of water will gradually move downriver over the next couple of days. - Residents are encouraged to continue to monitor water levels and move items along the riverbank to higher ground.
